entry.title: Combined summary - On the scalability issues of onboarding millions of LN mobile clients
entry.summary: The Bitcoin community has been discussing the implementation of BIP 157, a protocol that could improve privacy for light clients. However, there are concerns about scalability issues and potential DDoS attacks on the fullnode network. Some suggest watchtowers provide light-client services instead. The benefits of BIP 157 include unique filters for each block, downloading from multiple sources, and better privacy. It is an optional feature that no one is forced to use.There is also discussion around the potential for consensus capture in Bitcoin, where any subset of users whose interests diverge from the overall consensus could compromise the system. The costs of security are being externalized from light clients onto full nodes, making it harder to run full nodes and potentially pricing out some node operators. As node counts drop, the set of node operators will increasingly represent economic actors with extreme weight, leading to a natural instability in the system.Despite the potential benefits of fast, affordable, confidential, censorship-resistant payment services like LN, the security model of Bitcoin still relies first and foremost on running a full node. BIP 157 improves privacy of full-node-less usage, but provides no real benefits to full node users compared to more efficient protocols like Stratum/Electrum. Therefore, all efforts to improve the "full node-less" experience are harmful, and should be actively avoided.The article discusses the future of light client protocols in blockchain technology, particularly within the Lightning Network (LN). While light clients can provide fast and affordable payment services, they have concerns about their privacy and security guarantees. The deployment of BIP157 could lead to an effective DDoS on the full node network if a large number of BIP157 clients arise. The conversation also revolves around the current thinking on light clients and incentivized full node services. It suggests dedicating more resources to increase the health and security of the backbone network by deploying more outbound connections instead of relying on full-node operators to service millions of LN mobile clients. The concern with consensus capture by any subset of users whose interests diverge from the overall consensus is equally damaging as consensus capture by miners.There are also conversations around designing a mobile-first LN experience particularly in terms of scalability, security, and privacy. The use of part-time or Sleeper Nodes‚Ñ¢ could be a solution where phone nodes store and serve a randomly selected range of blocks during their nighttime operation while advertising the blocks they can serve. Additionally, monetary compensation can be introduced in exchange for servicing filters to price chain access resources and prevent free-riding on the network.Christopher Allen, founder of Blockchain Commons, expressed his interest in hosting a collaboration to define sets of wallet functionality. Refactoring in Core wallets is making good progress. QuickConnect, an emerging approach that allows for secure connection via Tor v3 from a remote device to a personal full node, has been suggested as a solution to connecting a mobile Lightning Network client to a home full node to prevent centralized services from gaining an advantage.
